definitions.definition: To make something holy by religious rite, sanctify .

examples: In some countries, priests bless farm animals on St. Anthony's Day.
In many families, a grace is said before dinner to give thanks for and bless the food.

definitions.definition: To honor as holy, glorify ; to extol for excellence.
To esteem or account happy; to felicitate .
To make the sign of the cross upon, so as to sanctify.
To turn (a reference ) into an object .
definitions.label_groups: Perl programming , transitive , past tense only blessed

definitions.definition: To secure, defend, or prevent from .

examples: Could you bless me the link for the original post?
I'm actually marved right now, can you bless me some cash?

definitions.definition: To approve of or assent to.
examples: After those modifications, the Board blessed the reorganization plan.

definitions.definition: To perform the mano gesture; taking of an elder 's hand to press it to one's forehead or kiss it ( as a sign of respect ) English Wikipedia has an article on: Mano (gesture) Wikipedia
examples: You should bless your relatives, because they arrived here already.

main_definition: To make something holy by religious rite, sanctify .
secondary_definitions: To honor as holy, glorify ; to extol for excellence.
To esteem or account happy; to felicitate .
( Christianity ) To make the sign of the cross upon, so as to sanctify.
( Perl programming , transitive , past tense only blessed ) To turn (a reference ) into an object .
( archaic , with from ) To secure, defend, or prevent from .
( MTE , slang ) To give or send .
( transitive ) To approve of or assent to.
( Philippines ) To perform the mano gesture; taking of an elder 's hand to press it to one's forehead or kiss it ( as a sign of respect ) English Wikipedia has an article on: Mano (gesture) Wikipedia
